11#ifndef CALL_RTP_DEMUXER_H_
12#define CALL_RTP_DEMUXER_H_
13
14#include <map>
15#include <set>
16#include <string>
17#include <unordered_map>
18#include <utility>
19#include <vector>
20
21#include "rtc_base/hash.h"
22
23namespace webrtc {
24
25class RtpPacketReceived;
26class RtpPacketSinkInterface;
27
28// This struct describes the criteria that will be used to match packets to a
29// specific sink.
30struct RtpDemuxerCriteria {
31 RtpDemuxerCriteria();
32 ~RtpDemuxerCriteria();
33
34 bool operator==(const RtpDemuxerCriteria& other) const;
35 bool operator!=(const RtpDemuxerCriteria& other) const;
36
37 // If not the empty string, will match packets with this MID.
38 std::string mid;
39
40 // If not the empty string, will match packets with this as their RTP stream
41 // ID or repaired RTP stream ID.
42 // Note that if both MID and RSID are specified, this will only match packets
43 // that have both specified (either through RTP header extensions, SSRC
44 // latching or RTCP).
45 std::string rsid;
46
47 // Will match packets with any of these SSRCs.
48 std::set<uint32_t> ssrcs;
49
50 // Will match packets with any of these payload types.
51 std::set<uint8_t> payload_types;
52
53 // Return string representation of demux criteria to facilitate logging
54 std::string ToString() const;
55};
56
57// This class represents the RTP demuxing, for a single RTP session (i.e., one
58// SSRC space, see RFC 7656). It isn't thread aware, leaving responsibility of
59// multithreading issues to the user of this class.
60// The demuxing algorithm follows the sketch given in the BUNDLE draft:
61// https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-mmusic-sdp-bundle-negotiation-38#section-10.2
62// with modifications to support RTP stream IDs also.
63//
64// When a packet is received, the RtpDemuxer will route according to the
65// following rules:
66// 1. If the packet contains the MID header extension, and no sink has been
67// added with that MID as a criteria, the packet is not routed.
68// 2. If the packet has the MID header extension, but no RSID or RRID extension,
69// and the MID is bound to a sink, then bind its SSRC to the same sink and
70// forward the packet to that sink. Note that rebinding to the same sink is
71// not an error. (Later packets with that SSRC would therefore be forwarded
72// to the same sink, whether they have the MID header extension or not.)
73// 3. If the packet has the MID header extension and either the RSID or RRID
74// extension, and the MID, RSID (or RRID) pair is bound to a sink, then bind
75// its SSRC to the same sink and forward the packet to that sink. Later
76// packets with that SSRC will be forwarded to the same sink.
77// 4. If the packet has the RSID or RRID header extension, but no MID extension,
78// and the RSID or RRID is bound to an RSID sink, then bind its SSRC to the
79// same sink and forward the packet to that sink. Later packets with that
80// SSRC will be forwarded to the same sink.
81// 5. If the packet's SSRC is bound to an SSRC through a previous call to
82// AddSink, then forward the packet to that sink. Note that the RtpDemuxer
83// will not verify the payload type even if included in the sink's criteria.
84// The sink is expected to do the check in its handler.
85// 6. If the packet's payload type is bound to exactly one payload type sink
86// through an earlier call to AddSink, then forward the packet to that sink.
87// 7. Otherwise, the packet is not routed.
88//
89// In summary, the routing algorithm will always try to first match MID and RSID
90// (including through SSRC binding), match SSRC directly as needed, and use
91// payload types only if all else fails.
92class RtpDemuxer {
93 public:
94 // Maximum number of unique SSRC bindings allowed. This limit is to prevent
95 // memory overuse attacks due to a malicious peer sending many packets with
96 // different SSRCs.
97 static constexpr int kMaxSsrcBindings = 1000;
98
99 // Returns a string that contains all the attributes of the given packet
100 // relevant for demuxing.
101 static std::string DescribePacket(const RtpPacketReceived& packet);
102
103 explicit RtpDemuxer(bool use_mid = true);
104 ~RtpDemuxer();
105
106 RtpDemuxer(const RtpDemuxer&) = delete;
107 void operator=(const RtpDemuxer&) = delete;
108
109 // Registers a sink that will be notified when RTP packets match its given
110 // criteria according to the algorithm described in the class description.
111 // Returns true if the sink was successfully added.
112 // Returns false in the following situations:
113 // - Only MID is specified and the MID is already registered.
114 // - Only RSID is specified and the RSID is already registered.
115 // - Both MID and RSID is specified and the (MID, RSID) pair is already
116 // registered.
117 // - Any of the criteria SSRCs are already registered.
118 // If false is returned, no changes are made to the demuxer state.
119 bool AddSink(const RtpDemuxerCriteria& criteria,
120 RtpPacketSinkInterface* sink);
121
122 // Registers a sink. Multiple SSRCs may be mapped to the same sink, but
123 // each SSRC may only be mapped to one sink. The return value reports
124 // whether the association has been recorded or rejected. Rejection may occur
125 // if the SSRC has already been associated with a sink. The previously added
126 // sink is *not* forgotten.
127 bool AddSink(uint32_t ssrc, RtpPacketSinkInterface* sink);
128
129 // Registers a sink's association to an RSID. Only one sink may be associated
130 // with a given RSID. Null pointer is not allowed.
131 void AddSink(const std::string& rsid, RtpPacketSinkInterface* sink);
132
133 // Removes a sink. Return value reports if anything was actually removed.
134 // Null pointer is not allowed.
135 bool RemoveSink(const RtpPacketSinkInterface* sink);
136
137 // Demuxes the given packet and forwards it to the chosen sink. Returns true
138 // if the packet was forwarded and false if the packet was dropped.
139 bool OnRtpPacket(const RtpPacketReceived& packet);
140
141 private:
142 // Returns true if adding a sink with the given criteria would cause conflicts
143 // with the existing criteria and should be rejected.
144 bool CriteriaWouldConflict(const RtpDemuxerCriteria& criteria) const;
145
146 // Runs the demux algorithm on the given packet and returns the sink that
147 // should receive the packet.
148 // Will record any SSRC<->ID associations along the way.
149 // If the packet should be dropped, this method returns null.
150 RtpPacketSinkInterface* ResolveSink(const RtpPacketReceived& packet);
151
152 // Used by the ResolveSink algorithm.
153 RtpPacketSinkInterface* ResolveSinkByMid(const std::string& mid,
154 uint32_t ssrc);
155 RtpPacketSinkInterface* ResolveSinkByMidRsid(const std::string& mid,
156 const std::string& rsid,
157 uint32_t ssrc);
158 RtpPacketSinkInterface* ResolveSinkByRsid(const std::string& rsid,
159 uint32_t ssrc);
160 RtpPacketSinkInterface* ResolveSinkByPayloadType(uint8_t payload_type,
161 uint32_t ssrc);
162
163 // Regenerate the known_mids_ set from information in the sink_by_mid_ and
164 // sink_by_mid_and_rsid_ maps.
165 void RefreshKnownMids();
166
167 // Map each sink by its component attributes to facilitate quick lookups.
168 // Payload Type mapping is a multimap because if two sinks register for the
169 // same payload type, both AddSinks succeed but we must know not to demux on
170 // that attribute since it is ambiguous.
171 // Note: Mappings are only modified by AddSink/RemoveSink (except for
172 // SSRC mapping which receives all MID, payload type, or RSID to SSRC bindings
173 // discovered when demuxing packets).
174 std::unordered_map<std::string, RtpPacketSinkInterface*> sink_by_mid_;
175 std::unordered_map<uint32_t, RtpPacketSinkInterface*> sink_by_ssrc_;
176 std::unordered_multimap<uint8_t, RtpPacketSinkInterface*> sinks_by_pt_;
177 std::unordered_map<std::pair<std::string, std::string>,
178 RtpPacketSinkInterface*,
179 webrtc::PairHash>
180 sink_by_mid_and_rsid_;
181 std::unordered_map<std::string, RtpPacketSinkInterface*> sink_by_rsid_;
182
183 // Tracks all the MIDs that have been identified in added criteria. Used to
184 // determine if a packet should be dropped right away because the MID is
185 // unknown.
186 std::set<std::string> known_mids_;
187
188 // Records learned mappings of MID --> SSRC and RSID --> SSRC as packets are
189 // received.
190 // This is stored separately from the sink mappings because if a sink is
191 // removed we want to still remember these associations.
192 std::unordered_map<uint32_t, std::string> mid_by_ssrc_;
193 std::unordered_map<uint32_t, std::string> rsid_by_ssrc_;
194
195 // Adds a binding from the SSRC to the given sink.
196 void AddSsrcSinkBinding(uint32_t ssrc, RtpPacketSinkInterface* sink);
197
198 const bool use_mid_;
199};
200
201} // namespace webrtc
202
203#endif // CALL_RTP_DEMUXER_H_
204
